intro: Cirrhopetalum sibuyanense, commonly known as the Sibuyan star orchid, is an endemic orchid species native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow with intricate patterns. The plant grows in montane forest habitats, often on tree trunks or rocks, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support for its delicate inflorescence. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
